Hi:
 Please excuse the foolish reply. "Mon" refers to lineage and I believe=
, and that the connection is closer than "Den" or tradition, a student teac=
her relationship.  Again I could be off base, but it seems that while the t=
suba is indeed Bushu, which covers quite a range of motif, the Ito characte=
ristic of wire cutting certainly isn't there. 
 AF

>>> jdz@... 08/14/0=

Sorry, I expressed my self unclearly.  I was having difficult=
y with the "Nidai Masatsune Mon" section of the upper line text in parenthe=
sis.  I was too dumb to put ni + dai together, and I rejected Masa for some=
 reason, and found myself another theory.  And I did not understand that "m=
on" meant "pupil." 

David
